peripherals.name: AI
peripherals.description: AI API responsible for controlling entities AI, toggling it and perform checks if it is enabled or disabled.

functions.name: toggleAI
functions.description: Tries to toggle AI of entity in specific direction

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The name of the peripheral to wrap.

returns.name: value1
returns.description:
table | nil The table containing the peripheral's methods, or nil if
there is no peripheral present with the given name.

peripherals.name: Capture
peripherals.description: Capture API allows moving block or entities with storing it internal data! So finally, you can move specific spawners and chests!

functions.name: capture
functions.description: Tries to capture block in specific direction

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction to capture the block from.

returns.name: value1
returns.description:
table | nil The table containing the peripheral's methods, or nil if
there is no peripheral present with the given name.

functions.name: release
functions.description: Tiers to release object: create entity or place block

returns.name: value1
returns.description:
Result The table containing the peripheral's methods, or nil if
there is no peripheral present with the given name.

functions.name: getCaptured
functions.description: Returns information about captured entity (including NBT data)

returns.name: value1
returns.description: table Returns information about captured entity (including NBT data)

peripherals.name: filterBlock
peripherals.description: This integration works with most blocks in Create that have a filter component, and it allows you to manipulate this filter from the computer.

functions.name: getFilterName
functions.description: Returns item ID of current filter

returns.name: value1
returns.description: ID of the current filter item

functions.name: setFilterItem
functions.description: Sets the filter to the specified item ID

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The item ID to set as the filter

peripherals.name: recipeRegistry
peripherals.description: This peripheral exists to provide help in extracting recipes from game and building complex recipe pipelines. It may not work as well as you would expect, but at least this is a start.

functions.name: getRecipeTypes
functions.description: Returns list of all recipe types in the game

returns.name: value1
returns.description: A table containing all registered recipes.

functions.name: getAllRecipesForType
functions.description: Returns all recipes for given recipe type

parameters.name: recipeTypeID
parameters.description: The ID of the recipe type to get recipes for.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: A table containing all recipes for the specified type.

parameters.name: recipeTypeID
parameters.description: The ID of the recipe type.

parameters.name: recipeID
parameters.description: The ID of the recipe to get.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: A table containing the recipe information, or nil if the recipe was not found.

functions.name: search
functions.description: Returns all recipe for item based on filter

parameters.name: itemID
parameters.description: The ID of the item to get recipes for.

returns.name: value1
returns.description: A table containing all recipes matching the filter for the specified item.

types.name: Result
types.description: A result type representing success or failure of an operation.

fields.name: success
fields.description: Indicates whether the operation was successful.

fields.name: message
fields.description: An optional message providing additional information about the operation.

types.name: Recipe
types.description: A recipe type representing a crafting recipe in the game.

fields.name: input
fields.description: An list of minecraft items required for the recipe

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the crafting type.

types.name: RecipeInput
types.description: The input object that is part of a recipe

types.name: RecipeOutput
types.description: the output object of a recipeOutput

fields.name: itemGroups
fields.description: list of itemgroups, like ores or ingots

fields.name: tags
fields.description: list of tags added to the item

fields.name: count
fields.description: the amount returned from an recipe

fields.name: maxCount
fields.description: the max stack size the item can have
